description.method_description: LFR maps each individual, represented as a data point in a given input space, to a probability distribution in a new representation space. The aim of this new representation is to lose any information that can identify whether the person belongs to the protected subgroup, while retaining as much other information as possible.

fairness.fairness_description: The method minimizes an objection which is a combination of demographic parity, information loss in the representation, and accuracy loss of the prediction label. The strength for each of these elements can be tuned.

implementation.description: Input data has to be formatted as an AIF360 dataset.

use_cases.description: Experiments were conducted on Adult \cite{adult_2}, German credit \cite{german_credit_data}, and Heritage Health Prize milestone 1 challenge \cite{Brierley_Vogel_Axelrod} in \citet{Zemel13}.
